title: Coke’s U.S. Launch of an Energy Drink Could Drain Monster Beverage Stock
text:
Text size

Photograph by Patrick T. Fallon/Bloomberg

Monster Beverage stock fell Wednesday as an analyst downgraded the energy drink company’s shares following Coca-Cola ’s announcement that its own energy drinks are headed for the U.S.

Monster stock (ticker: MNST), up 15% in 2019 through Tuesday’s close at $56.42, was recently down 2.5% to $55.04 as the S&P 500 was down about 1%. Guggenheim analyst Laurent Grandet downgraded the shares to Neutral from Buy, cutting his price target to $60 from $74, below FactSet’s average a bit below $66.

Coca-Cola (KO) said Tuesday that Coca-Cola Energy, already available abroad, will come to the U.S. in four varieties in January. Sold in 12-ounce cans the company described as “sleek,” they may remind some consumers of cans of Red Bull. Coke’s shares were recently down slightly at $54.24.
description: An analyst downgraded Monster Beverage’s stock following Coca-Cola’s announcement that its own energy drinks are headed for the U.S.
